page.title: 07ALRESFORD INDUSTRY
page.content: Alresford is far from being industrialised, being largely a 'dormitory' town with the majority of the population travelling to the larger towns such as Basingstoke and Winchester, with a sizeable number commuting to London. There are, however,two 'industrial' areas. The Dean houses a dozen or so small factories , mainly concerned with light engineering such as agricultural and garden machinery, but there is also a branch of a cosmetics manufacturing group. The other zone is New Farm road with again light engineering but also a timber-working concern with large timber yard. Service industries provide a substantial employment and there is also a toy firm; Alresford Crafts.
